snippet: T-Mobile is angling for more low-frequency airwaves, while Dish Networks has amassed mid-spectrum airwaves, until recently thought to be much less valuable.
abstract: Premium value of wireless spectrum is at heart of potential deal between Dish Networks and T-Mobile; Dish has bought up significant amount of spectrum at government auctions amid redistribution effort by Federal Communications Commission; deal could disrupt stranglehold on spectrum market held by AT&T and Verizon.
lead_paragraph: T-Mobile is angling for more low-frequency airwaves, while Dish Networks has amassed mid-spectrum airwaves, until recently thought to be much less valuable.

headline.main: Questions on Spectrum Animate T-Mobile-Dish Merger Talks
headline.print_headline: Spectrum Has Central Role in Dish’s Merger Talks
